pr_title: Exclude patterns and files from Find In Files search and replace

timeline.message: update RPCs to send/accept excludeFilePatterns, remove gitIgnore code
fix display bugs

remove gitIgnore from cpp code,
fix bug not defaulting to previous state after exclude custom selected
start implementing reading of gitignore (WIP)
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio into feature/replace-git-ignore
fix initialization of excludeFilePatterns, ignore some files in .gitignore
refactor createGitIgnoreString, make string include every .gitignore file
remove code causing UI to fail
uncomment accessibility changes, now working as expected

Revert "uncomment accessibility changes, now working as expected"

This reverts commit 12f77b688a1e70cc6281414366d3f6b9e99e39d5.
Fix bug causing previously commented out code to work. Add aria properties to new span field.
fix case
fix git command to check for ignored files
rename gitignore variables to accurately represent exclude-standard functionality

timeline.bodyText: Should this be [] since the function returns an array?
timeline.author: jmcphers

timeline.bodyText: Nit: for very complicated reasons, we prefer StringUtil.equals (GWT has actually changed the way string comparison works between releases!)
timeline.author: jmcphers

timeline.message: refactor code to meet standards
use `git grep` when excluding standard git exclusions to prevent an unbounded amount of output
use `git grep` when excluding standard git exclusions to prevent an unbounded amount of output
use `git grep` when excluding standard git exclusions to prevent an unbounded amount of output
Merge branch 'feature/replace-git-ignore' of https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio into feature/replace-git-ignore
remove extra function declaration (wip)

make Find in Files functional with `git grep`
- standard output from `git grep` differs from `grep` and this needs to be accounted for when
  parsing our results

update FindInFilesState to save data related to replace previews on pause
- also made updateFrequency_ in progress const bc it shouldn't change

update FindInFilesState to save data related to replace previews on pause
- also made updateFrequency_ in progress const bc it shouldn't change

add unit tests for regexes used to parse stdout results
- move regex retrieval to SessionFind.hpp
- also fix bug where exclude no longer worked with git grep,
  and never worked when multiple patterns were requested
- renamed some existing unit test variables to match standards

update the UI so a user cannot input file patterns when using git exclusions
as git grep doesn't have an equivalent to grep's --include

update the UI so a user cannot input file patterns when using git exclusions
as git grep doesn't have an equivalent to grep's --include

update the UI so a user cannot input file patterns when using git exclusions
as git grep doesn't have an equivalent to grep's --include
remove old comment

rename functions using retrieve because we are not fetching
update include/exclude file patterns to use enums for readability
disable the Git option when git is not installed

fix issue where in rare cases ReplaceOperationEndedEvent wasn't getting called and the progress bar
was visible after the replace had completed
- removed code unnsuccesfully trying to fix this

disable Standard Git Exclusions selection when git is not installed or a git repo isn't selected
add value change handler to Find In Files directory chooser, on changes check if the new directory
is a git repository and if git is installed
add new Files Server operation to check if a directory is a git directory

timeline.bodyText: Nit: GWT has automatic unboxing so this could be simplified to dialog.setGitStatus(isGitDirectory)
timeline.author: jmcphers

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we should only add this value change handler when session_.getSessionInfo().isVcsAvailable is true? (otherwise there's no point as we'd never show git options)
timeline.author: jmcphers

timeline.message: only check if a directory is a git directory if git is installed

timeline.bodyText: Nit: could you rename this includeFilePatterns to mirror excludeFilePatterns, as well as other occurrences? I think that would make it a bit clearer when just glancing over the code.
timeline.author: MariaSemple
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,15 +62,15 @@ public static native State createState(String query,
                                              String path,
                                              boolean regex,
                                              boolean caseSensitive,
-                                             boolean gitIgnore,
-                                             JsArrayString filePatterns) /*-{
+                                             JsArrayString filePatterns,

timeline.message:
refactor git grep changes for readability and bug fix
- fix potential bug when regex doesn't return 3 matches
- remame filePatterns to includeFilePatterns for clarity
- create grep/git grep commands separately
- renamed function to parse grep output
add safety check and add comment for clarity

fix initialization of excludeFilePatterns, ignore some files in .gitignore, improve accessibility

refactor createGitIgnoreString, make string include every .gitignore file

fix case

fix git command to check for ignored files

rename gitignore variables to accurately represent exclude-standard functionality

refactor code to meet standards
use `git grep` when excluding standard git exclusions to prevent an unbounded amount of output

make Find in Files functional with `git grep`
- standard output from `git grep` differs from `grep` and this needs to be accounted for when
  parsing our results

update FindInFilesState to save data related to replace previews on pause
- also made updateFrequency_ in progress const bc it shouldn't change

add unit tests for regexes used to parse stdout results
- move regex retrieval to SessionFind.hpp
- also fix bug where exclude no longer worked with git grep,
  and never worked when multiple patterns were requested
- renamed some existing unit test variables to match standards

update the UI so a user cannot input file patterns when using git exclusions
as git grep doesn't have an equivalent to grep's --include

rename functions using retrieve because we are not fetching
update include/exclude file patterns to use enums for readability
disable the Git option when git is not installed

fix issue where in rare cases ReplaceOperationEndedEvent wasn't getting called and the progress bar
was visible after the replace had completed
- removed code unnsuccesfully trying to fix this

disable Standard Git Exclusions selection when git is not installed or a git repo isn't selected
add value change handler to Find In Files directory chooser, on changes check if the new directory
is a git repository and if git is installed
add new Files Server operation to check if a directory is a git directory
only check if a directory is a git directory if git is installed

refactor git grep changes for readability and bug fix
- fix potential bug when regex doesn't return 3 matches
- remame filePatterns to includeFilePatterns for clarity
- create grep/git grep commands separately
- renamed function to parse grep output
add safety check and add comment for clarity
Merge branch 'feature/replace-git-ignore' of https://github.com/rstudio/rstudio into feature/replace-git-ignore
move excludeFilePatterns derivatives into GrepOptions and switch GrepOptions to a class
remove const when returning by-value
